definition: to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)

sentences.english: Teutonic, based on an old Latin quote, or
sentences.chinese: 它来自条顿语，这一猜测基于一条古拉丁语的引述。

sentences.english: So the hippodrome is the circus in Latin.
sentences.chinese: 所以赛马场就是拉丁语中的马戏表演场。

sentences.english: Madame de Genlis was superstitious and a Latinist.
sentences.chinese: 让利斯夫人有些迷信而且还是个拉丁语学者。

sentences.english: For a long period of time Latin was the literary language of Italy.
sentences.chinese: 在很长一段时间里，拉丁语是意大利的文学语言。

sentences.english: Thousands of English words are derived from Latin.
sentences.chinese: 数以千计的英语词汇源自拉丁语。

sentences.english: The foreign influences barbarized the Latin language.
sentences.chinese: 外来影响使拉丁语变得不规范。

sentences.english: She learns to speak Latin by osmosis within three months.
sentences.chinese: 她废寝忘食地在三个月内学会了拉丁语。

sentences.english: I had to bone up on my Latin verbs before the final exam .
sentences.chinese: 期末考试前我得苦攻一下我的拉丁语动词。

sentences.english: He had an excellent command of Latin and Greek through self-learning.
sentences.chinese: 通过自学，他已经很好地掌握了拉丁语和希腊语。

sentences.english: And so it passed into Latin and then much later into English in the 1500s.
sentences.chinese: 之后传到拉丁语里，更晚的16世纪传到了英语里。

sentences.english: “Placebo” is derived from a Latin word meaning “I shall please.
sentences.chinese: “安慰剂”一词来自于拉丁语，意为“使愉悦”。

sentences.english: In his book, he introduced the decimal number system to the Latin-speaking world.
sentences.chinese: 在这书中，他引入阿拉伯数系于拉丁语国家。

sentences.english: This word derives itself from Latin.
This is the same argument you tend to hear for learning Latin.
sentences.chinese: 这和常听到的学习拉丁语的论调很类似。

sentences.english: He learned a bit of Latin.
At first they worked in Latin.
sentences.chinese: 最开始他们用拉丁语工作。

definition: radical of a compound word (in European language)
